channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In one key swing state, both parties are courting Black men
item.description: With North Carolina now a toss-up this presidential election, both parties are making appeals to Black men. An older farmer and a younger restaurant owner share what's driving their votes.
item.content:encoded:
With North Carolina now a toss-up this presidential election, both parties are making appeals to Black men. An older farmer and a younger restaurant owner share what's driving their votes.

(Image credit: Melissa Gray)
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: The human cost of ghost networks
item.description: He tried to find a therapist who would take his insurance. He did not succeed.
item.content:encoded:
He tried to find a therapist who would take his insurance. He did not succeed.

(Image credit: Webber Coutinho family)
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: 'I Don’t Want to Die.' He needed mental health care. He found a ghost network
item.description: Ravi Coutinho bought a health insurance plan thinking it would give him access to mental health providers. But even after 21 phone calls and multiple hospitalizations, no one could find him a therapist.
item.content:encoded: Ravi Coutinho bought a health insurance plan thinking it would give him access to mental health providers. But even after 21 phone calls and multiple hospitalizations, no one could find him a therapist.
item.dc:creator: Max Blau

item.title: Money for cutting-edge climate technology could dry up in a second Trump term
item.description: A hydrogen plant in Utah could offer a new path to slash fossil-fuel pollution. But federal funding that was critical for projects like this one could dry up if Donald Trump is reelected.
item.content:encoded:
A hydrogen plant in Utah could offer a new path to slash fossil-fuel pollution. But federal funding that was critical for projects like this one could dry up if Donald Trump is reelected.

(Image credit: George Frey)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: Up against a 'ghost network' for mental health care? Here's what you can do
item.description: Insurers’ failures to update their provider directories have led to dire consequences for people seeking mental health care. Here's how you can navigate these challenges to find treatment.
item.content:encoded:
Insurers’ failures to update their provider directories have led to dire consequences for people seeking mental health care. Here's how you can navigate these challenges to find treatment.

(Image credit: Stone RF)
item.dc:creator: Max Blau

item.title: Dozens of rockets fired into Israel from Lebanon, IDF says
item.description: Over 100 rockets were fired into Israel from Lebanon early Sunday, with some landing near the northern city of Haifa, as Israel and the Hezbollah militant group appeared to be spiraling.
item.content:encoded:
Over 100 rockets were fired into Israel from Lebanon early Sunday, with some landing near the northern city of Haifa, as Israel and the Hezbollah militant group appeared to be spiraling.

(Image credit: Gil Nechushtan/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Israel raids and shuts down Al Jazeera's bureau in Ramallah in the West Bank
item.description: Israeli troops raided the offices of the satellite news network Al Jazeera in the Israeli-occupied West Bank early Sunday, ordering the bureau to shut down.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli troops raided the offices of the satellite news network Al Jazeera in the Israeli-occupied West Bank early Sunday, ordering the bureau to shut down.

(Image credit: Al Jazeera/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 'The West Wing' cast visited the White House to celebrate the show's 25th anniversary
item.description: The cast and creators of the hit political drama West Wing celebrated the series' 25th anniversary during a visit to the White House.
item.content:encoded:
The cast and creators of the hit political drama West Wing celebrated the series' 25th anniversary during a visit to the White House.

(Image credit: Samuel Corum)
item.dc:creator: Michael Levitt

item.title: New center-right government in France announced 2 months after divisive elections
item.description: The French presidential palace unveiled a new government dominated by conservatives and centrists. A left-wing coalition secured the most seats in June-July elections but failed to win a majority.
item.content:encoded:
The French presidential palace unveiled a new government dominated by conservatives and centrists. A left-wing coalition secured the most seats in June-July elections but failed to win a majority.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Okinawa's governor strives for regional diplomacy as tensions in Asia-Pacific rise
item.description: Denny Tamaki, governor of Okinawa prefecture, says his personal story is deeply entwined with the U.S. military’s presence on the island.
item.content:encoded:
Denny Tamaki, governor of Okinawa prefecture, says his personal story is deeply entwined with the U.S. military’s presence on the island.

(Image credit: Behrouz Mehri)
item.dc:creator: Monica Miller
